data.title: Waukegan Public Library
data.text: Edition Widescreen format. Descript 1 videodisc (131 min.) : sound, color ; 4 3/4 in. two-dimensional moving image tdi rdacontent video v rdamedia videodisc vd rdacarrier System Det DVD; Dolby digital 5.1 surround; region 1. Cast Sean Connery, F. Murray Abraham, Elya Baskin, Feodor Chaliapin, Jr., William Hickey, Michael Lonsdale, Ron Perlman, Volker Prechtel, Helmut Qualtinger, Valentina Vargas, Christian Slater. Credits Director of photography, Tonino Delli Colli ; editor, Jane Seitz ; music, James Horner. Note Based on the novel Il nome della rosa by Umberto Eco. Originally produced as a motion picture in 1986. Special features: commentary by Annaud; "The abbey of crime" production documentary; photo video journey with Annaud; theatrical trailer. Audience MPAA rating: R. Summary Investigating the deaths of two monks, a visiting brother discovers a secret library containing rare books considered lost to the world and dangerous to the Catholic faith. Note Soundtrack in English; subtitles in English, French or Spanish ; Closed-captioned. Subject Monastic and religious life -- Drama. Monastic libraries -- Drama. Monasticismo y órdenes religiosas -- Drama. Bibliotecas monásticas -- Drama. Genre Detective and mystery films. Film adaptations. Feature films. Video recordings for the hearing impaired. Local Subj DVD videodiscs. Alt Author Eichinger, Bernd. Schaefers, Bernd. Annaud, Jean-Jacques. Birkin, Andrew. Brach, Gérard. Franklin, Howard. Godard, Alain (Screenwriter) Connery, Sean. Abraham, F. Murray. Lonsdale, Michael. Vargas, Valentina, 1964- Slater, Christian. Eco, Umberto. Nome della rosa. ISBN 0790764997 ISBN/ISSN 085393746520
